title: I don't like last hit mechanics
body:
So there's two instances where I don't like last hitting.

1) Which should be obvious for the title is last hitting minions for gold.  I don't like the mechanic at all.  It favors some champions hugely over others.  I would say very simply any hero that did damage to a minion when it dies gets a cut of the gold.

If a minion would yield 20 gold on death and 2 heroes hit it before it died, they each get 10 gold.  If 3 heroes hit it before it died, they each get 7 gold (round up).  I think this would make a much better balance for heroes that can't toss powers out just to finish 5 minions at once.

2) Now the one that probably isn't obvious for the title is last hitting heroes for a kill.  I've actually hated this tactic for a long long time across many games like MMO's and FPS's. I believe the person who does the MAJORITY DAMAGE should get credit for the kill.  Not just some guy who saved his power up for the last hit.

This would also alleviate people who stupidly save hard hitting powers up literally just to get credit for a kill.  I've seen instances where it's a 2v1 or 3v1 situation and it's already 100% guaranteed going to be a kill just by auto attacking.  But people toss out their ults just to get the credit for the kill.  How stupid is this.

We feel last hitting's good for the game for a number of reasons, including:


**It's an important expression of skill**

Last hitting, when you're by yourself, is relatively straight forward. As soon as you add in enemy players however it becomes a lot more difficult. Last hitting well, while at the same time harassing the enemy when they try to last hit, watching the rest of the map, looking for opportunities to all etc can be really difficult. Shifting from a model where 'last hit = gold' to 'any hit = gold' or 'proximity = gold' removes or reduces a bunch of laning skills we believe are good for LoL. 


**It drives action**

Last hitting in lane creates moments where at least one champion is vulnerable as they move forwards more than they otherwise would, briefly stand still when they otherwise wouldn't, use mana/CDs to farm instead of saving them or harassing etc. 


**It offers ways to make champions more distinct**

Because last hitting's important the tools a champion has to last hit with or interact with other champions as they last hit are particularly important in lane. To look at an example a notable amount of Ezreal's distinctiveness comes from how he interacts with minions in lane. His Q is a safe, cheap tool that makes it easy to pick up some farm from a distance. On the other hand he lacks AOE wave clear apart from his ult, so he can be denied quite a bit of farm if you push him to his tower.

Im surprised you guys take last hitting so seriously. Albeit, I never thought that someone would end up complaining about it, cause I thought it was just a mechanic of the game that everyone took for granted..........like buying items. I'll admit, it is surprising to see this detailed of a response to something so fundamental of the game, very few people ever think about it unless they have kill stolen from them.........and then they forget about it 3 seconds later.

Digging into the fundamental stuff that it's easy to take for granted can be really useful in game design. The basic actions that make up the game (movement, last hitting, leveling up, buying items, death timers etc) are the foundation that everything else gets built on. If you don't get that stuff right you could have the best designed characters possible and you still might not have a fun or interesting game. Modifying them can be risky as a result, but there are a number of problems (e.g. excessive income disparities between roles) that are sometimes better solved at that foundational level than with individual pieces of content like items.

Have you ever thought of changing the way assist gold works? Or rather the amount of gold one gets when they have a bunch of assists.

> When a champion is killed, the main killer gets a certain amount of gold, while 50% of that amount is divided up among everyone who got an assist on it.
If a player has 2 more assists than kills they earn 30 additional gold for their next assist. If they have 3 more, it's 45, and 4 more assists than kills reaches the bonus cap of 60 extra gold. This bonus cannot be more than the original value of the kill.

I personally think it would be great if some of the assist gold got relocated to the support itemization to balance out the support game where the fed team support is basically another AP carry or a bruiser/tank and the losing team support has to become a warding machine.

Some supports can get up to 80-90% of the teams kills as assists simply by doing very minimal things (shielding/healing/slowing etc.)

How gold from assists and bonus gold from shutting people on kill streaks down works is something we're planning to look at a bit later this year come the preseason. No firm plans yet, if time permits might look at some other income tweaks as well. Shifting gold from assists to items would definitely be a valid approach if excessive gold differences for winning versus losing supports is something we identify, not sure yet if that'll be the case though.

As a jungle Eve main, I need my assist gold or I'm useless.

And if I'm stronger than my allies and end up taking the kills in all my ganks.... My team needs their assist gold, or THEY will be useless.

Please don't shift "support gold" using assists. Assists are not a support-exclusive mechanic.

What you COULD do, which would actually be very interesting, is add bounties to people who have assist streaks. So you can shut down that 0/0/30 Janna and actually get some gold for it. That way if you're the "losing support" and you and your ADC manage to kill that 0/0/5 Leona, you can actually turn the lane (and the game) around by making skillful plays. This would also force the winning bot lane to play more carefully, because if they were both on a streak (one kill streak and one assist streak) and got double killed and double shut down, they would pretty much completely lose their lead for being stupid about it.
OR they could just increase the money gained from Hunter's Machete as compensation.

I had a long reply but accidentally deleted it. So i'll make this question short and sweet. 

You didn't explain why last hitting champions was also important. It feels counter intuitive and encourages pause of action in the midst of a fight to ensure the carry gets the last hit. Supports need to stop "supporting" and carries need to pause attacking to snipe kills essentially. It also feels like you are rewarding bad players when you allow players that fell behind to be "fed" gold by just being there at just the fringes or the very  end of a fight to get last hits when their teammates did all the work/damage. 

While I think dealing a killing blow should earn a bonus reward, I don't feel like it should be rewarded as much as actually dealing the most damage in the fight.

Don't you think that the bar for last hitting might be a little high during the laning phase?

>Shifting from a model where 'last hit = gold' to 'any hit = gold' or 'proximity = gold' removes or reduces a bunch of laning skills we believe are good for LoL. 

The only problem some people have with this is if you give up a kill or two in certain matchups, you can't farm at all.  That means walking out of the laning phase 0-2-0 with 50 CS with the person you were going against is  2-0-0 with 90.  You can rarely come back from that.  In turn if you have a bad start, the rest of the game is an exercise in frustration as your teammates are constantly complaining about how much you suck.

So, a good skill for players to have means lots of toxicity when you get out played.

Then there's supports who riot always treats like the redheaded step child in discussions of getting gold.  I really love the Sins of a Dark Age model for getting supports gold from CS.  We need something like that for supports.

I feel like last-hitting is a bit...mixed.

On one hand it makes for interesting lane dynamics, on the other hand it's a mechanical skill gate that can make it harder for new players to access teamfights, itemization decisions, etc--and one that seems somewhat "meh"/arbitrary if you're coming into the game without really knowing the point behind CSing mechanics.

It feels like if I can't play the laning minigame I sometimes but don't always like, I can't effectively participate in the teamfights I enjoy playing more.

I feel like it might be a decent idea to test out a fallback/"forgiveness mechanic" that provides players with *less* gold than proper CSing, but gives less experienced players more forgiveness (while giving experienced players more options when behind).

For example: hitting a minion applies a mark that, should that minion die in the next 3 seconds, provides a certain fraction of the gold one would get from a "clean" CS. The longer the minion goes without dying, the less gold is earned from the mark. (Maybe 40% gold at the start, and 10% gold at the end?)

Possible: Only the mark from the last champion to hit the minion counts for "who gets gold" purposes.

So Ezreal--especially if that Ezreal was a newbie--would still be able to get *something* besides soaking XP at his tower, but he probably still wouldn't be able to get nearly as much gold out of the wave as he would normally.

It's a change that would still alter the economics of laning, but less so than completely replacing CSing mechanics.

What do you think of that?

The biggest problems with last hitting is that it really drives melee vs ranged matches into the favor of ranged champions especially early game where the melee champions will lose gold/last hits or eat a lot of poke and harass
Melee champions often have to go all in to have the possibility to trade with or beat ranged champions however this is often really difficult early game as minions are rather strong early game
Here is an honest question. What are your thoughts on last hit thresholds that 300 heroes has?

About driving the action; you still need to push the lane, to damage tower, even if you don't need to last-hit. Look at HotS.
The minions still deal damage also.

A possibility to remove last hitting would be to amp up minions damage to champs(and maybe turrets?), which would mean you would be more careful when trading with minions around, which means you need to push up your wave to win, and that means you'll attack minions which also creates a moment of weakness, they would also be more dangerous to towers then.

It is an expression of skill though, and it does create more interesting match-ups at times. In the scenario of stronger minions, you would still push in on Ez, to damage tower, and he would still struggle with wave clear.

Waveclear WOULD be more valuable with stronger minions, and it is already a bit too valuable in current iteration of league, and I don't think LoL would be more interesting without last hitting, it's too far into the lifetime of the game and as it's one of the basic systems of league EVERYTHING on top of it, would have to be reworked.

tl;dr; No last hitting is an interesting concept for a moba, but not feasible to do with LoL at this point, which is too based on last hitting as a mechanic.

TLDR Go play Smite.

The last hitting mechanic is crucial to this game's stake in the competitive genre. If gold gained from any damage dealt to a minion, me being better than my lane opponent (player to player) means nothing. The ADC role gets hit hardest by this as any champion with the slightest aoe and poke can force them out of lane, thus making them miss out of being there to damage minions and losing gold.

Also Support champions would want to share gold so they could purchase items quicker, Which further reduces the ADC's gold income. This change would disallow them to purchase their high cost items, which are necessary for them to do their job, effectively removing them from meta if not viability across all levels of play.

To your second point, this game has no Team Deathmatch Mode (TDM) and as such has never been about kills.To my earlier point about league not being TDM kills are only as important as the objective (turret, dragon, baron) a team is able to secure afterwards. This game was never about kills, it was **alway** about destroying the nexus.

Once again, removing the last hit mechanic from the game here would remove a class of champions all together. This time, it's assassins whose job it is to pick off low health targets. If a target gets bursted down in the heat of the fight, and they are the only one who can secure the kill, it should be theirs.

Now you have vision advantage because your support can buy an early pink or early sightstone, denying vision to a critical region on the map (dragon and tribush) so that your jungler or mid can come gank and snowball bot even further. In addition bot lane is now 2v1 and you can zone the enemy ADC.

You have two options.

1: Go play something else. If you hate the mechanic that much, don't play the game. What you are suggesting is a drastic change and would remove a core mechanic of the game. It's not going to happen.

2: Get better at last-hitting. If you're good at it, it isn't that annoying. Plus, you will then reach a skill level where people are less likely to try any stupid kill-stealing stunts.

In honesty i don' t like last hitting itself that much too, but mostly from a design point of view: it feels awkward and inelegant.

But the advantages of such system are really really too much to forsake, and so far i don' t have met another system that expresses so fully the skill, the interaction and the reward of last hitting with enough satisfaction.
Heroes of the Storm has no last hitting.  Try that game
This moba is not for for you if you have a problem with a core mechanic like this. Smite or hots might be a better moba for you over all.
If you don't like last hitting, you probably won't like League. You can Jungle/Support but even then being able to last hit is just a skill you should have.

I actually think this is one of the CORE reasons why I got bored of heros of the storm after about a month of playing - it simply doesn't have enough things to keep me interested. You go into the game, not having to worry about gold/exp[last hit] and all you have to worry about is trading/fighting with the enemy heros or shoving waves to towers as fast as you can, repeat that for the start of every game, the game gets dull, very, very fast. 

Whereas last hitting in lane makes it very interesting and fun, because there are a ton of things you can do during the lane phase to get an edge on your lane opponent, some people ignore the cs and just all ins you level 2/3 to kill you repeatedly, others let you push in the wave a bit, freeze it near tower and safely last hit.........I think you just gotta get good with last hit, since games like heros of the storm that takes out alot of the mechanics commonly found in league/dota becomes very boring very fast
